items.title: Optus CEO says ‚Äòcompulsory escalation process‚Äô for reports of triple-zero failures to be introduced ‚Äì as it happened
items.content_html:
This blog is now closed

Low tariffs not dependent on sit-down meeting with Trump, Bowen says

On the potential for a meeting between Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump, Bowen has poured cold water on whether any charm offensive by the Australian PM might have turned the US from its present course.

There are plenty of world leaders who have met with Donald Trump who haven‚Äôt had good outcomes, who have got very high tariffs. Who have come over, had meetings, left optimistic and then they‚Äôve got high tariffs. The way Anthony Albanese has managed the relationship, we have the world‚Äôs lowest tariff on Australia.

Results matter, David. Of course, the prime minister has made it clear he‚Äôs very happy to meet, but results matter. And this prime minister and this foreign minister and this government have delivered pretty good results when it comes to the bilateral relationship.

It‚Äôs not my place to announce these things, David. I‚Äôm a humble cabinet minister.

Of course a meeting with the president is always a good thing. But I‚Äôll tell you what‚Äôs even more important is results. I‚Äôd much rather Anthony Albanese get a great result for our economy with the world‚Äôs lowest tariff without a meeting, than to have a meeting and get the opposite result, which is what many other world leaders have found themselves in that situation.

Well, we obviously have set Australia‚Äôs foreign policy based on our interests and our values. And while everyone is entitled to their views, we will determine Australian foreign policy, not anyone else. And we‚Äôve determined a couple of things ‚Äì that the time is right, in concert, as you said, with like-minded states.

We have been waiting 80 years for a two-state solution, and that we now see recognising Palestine as a step towards a two-state solution, not the result of negotiations.
